result.execSummary:
The defendant Tamara N. Hightower was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent authorization.

Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. 
DNA sample. 
Jail credit applies if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol and no possession of them except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department. 

Payment of any unpaid financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:01 am 
INCLUDES 17CF24, 17CM406, 16CF1088, 14CF204, 12CF666, AND 12CF161. 
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Genelle Johnson. 

PLEA HEARING IN 17CF24, 17CM406, AND 16CF1088.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  
State moves to
In 17CF24: Ct. 2 (Theft/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 17CM406: Ct. 1 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 17CF24: Ct. 1 (Burglary/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF1088: Ct. 1 (Take & Drive Vehicle without Consent/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 17CF24 AND 16CF1088 AND SENTENCE AFTER REVOCATION IN 14CF204, 12CF666, AND 12CF161. 
Def makes statement. VRCW. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 17CF24: Ct. 1>>7 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 4 years ES - with NO sentence credit. 
In 16CF1088: Ct. 1>>7 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 4 years ES - with NO sentence credit. 
In 14CF204: Ct. 1>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - with 441 days sentence credit. 
                    : Ct. 2>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - with 441 days sentence credit. 
                    : Ct. 3>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - with 441 days sentence credit. 
                    : Ct. 4>>30 days MCJ with 411 days sentence credit. 
In 12CF666: Ct. 1>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - with 411 days sentence credit. 
                    : Ct. 3>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - with 411 days sentence credit. 
In 12CF161: Ct. 1>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - with 411 days sentence credit. 
                    : Ct. 3>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years IC & 3 years ES - with 411 days sentence credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES ON ALL>>AODA (unless one has already been done); assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol and no possession of them except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no contact with victims unless authorized by agent in 17CF24 & 16CF1088; write letters of apology to victims in 17CF24 & 16CF10888; CC in new files including DNA surcharge (sample already on file); unpaid financial obligations in revocations. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 

COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands def into custody of MCSD for transport to WI State Prison System. 
Adj: 9:22 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:45 am 
INCLUDES 12CF161, 12CF666, 14CF204, and 14CF788. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Paul Goetz.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to:
In 12CF161: Ct. 2 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater/2nd and Subsequent Offense)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 12CF666: Ct. 2 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF204: Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF788: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent THC/2nd & Subsequent Offense/Repeater)>>AMEND to Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater pursuant to 961.41(3g)(e). 
                   : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                   : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                   : Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 12CF161: Ct. 1 (Possession of Cocaine (2nd+)/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 12CF666: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF204: Amended Ct. 1 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF788: Ct. 1 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: In 12CF161, 12CF666, and 14CF204>>SWH for 10 years probation on each count to run concurrent - CONDITIONS: assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by agent; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; DNA sample;  payment of court costs. 
                            : On Ct. 1 in 14CF788>>1 year MCJ with huber or electronic monitor if def qualifies under jail criteria and payment of court costs. 
COURT remits DNA surcharges in 12CF161 and 12CF66. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to 146 days credit in 12CF161, 12CF666, and 14CF204 if revoked. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to 24 days credit in 14CF788. 

Adj: 9:17 am
Sent to Judge
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 25, 2014 at 08:45 am.
